content.question: In the absence of air friction, an object dropped near the surface of the Earth experiences a constant acceleration of about 9.8 m/s2. This means that the

choices.label: speed of the object increases 9.8 m/s during each second
speed of the object as it falls is 9.8 m/s
object falls 0.9 meters during each second
object falls 9.8 meters during the first second only
derivative of the distance with respect to time for the object equals 9.8 m/s2

content.answer: speed of the object increases 9.8 m/s during each second

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
